definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: A rise in prices nullifies a rise in wages.
sentences.chinese: 物價上漲抵銷了工資的增加。

sentences.english: The obligor May avail itself of any set-off against the assignee.
sentences.chinese: 債務人可以向受讓人主張抵銷。

sentences.english: The gains are balanced by the losses.
This part also introduces the debtor's right of defense and right of offset.
sentences.chinese: 同時，該部分對債務人之抗辯權和抵銷權也作了介紹。

sentences.english: How the management risk that countervail low hold the belt brings.
sentences.chinese: 如何抵銷低價奪標帶來的經營風險。

sentences.english: The right of set-off is exercised by notice to the other party.
sentences.chinese: 行使抵銷權時，應該通知另一方當事人。

sentences.english: But it is, so to speak , a self- canceling item.
sentences.chinese: 但是這可以說是一種“自身抵銷”的項目。

sentences.english: It makes a lovely picture, the bamboo houses set off by green plantain trees.
sentences.chinese: 它使一個可愛的圖片，竹房屋抵銷的綠色芭蕉樹。

sentences.english: By moving the head forward during the stride, many elements of the swing become compromised.
sentences.chinese: 在打擊時，頭向前移，許多的揮棒的因素相互抵銷了。

sentences.english: Dual off-set hook-and-loop straps promote a custom fit.
sentences.chinese: 雙抵銷鉤環帶，促進定製適合。

sentences.english: Households saved more, but this was more than offset by increased government “dissaving”.
sentences.chinese: 家庭儲蓄更多，但是這被持續增加的政府支出抵銷。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
